chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

defendant.name: Woods, Robert L.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
of Plea and Sentencing Hearing held on 2/18/15 before Honorable Gregory Grau
(filed in 13CF629)

Clerk Cheree
Cases 13CF629, 14CF405 and 14CF644 called: 2:50pm
State appears by ADA M.Puerner.  Def appears in person/in custody and with Atty John Wallace.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW - victim impact statement filed.

NGI pleas on all counts are withdrawn by Attorney Wallace
COURT questions defendant re: withdrawing NGI plea - COURT finds withdrawal freely and voluntarily made and allows withdrawal of NGI pleas in all counts.

State moves to:
14CF405>>D&RI entire file
13CF629 - Ct. 4 (Substantial Battery/Intend Bodily Harm/Repeater)>>D&RI
14CF644 - Ct. 2 (Felony BJ/Repeater)>>D&RI
COURT GRANTS ABOVE

PLEA:
13CF629 - Ct. 1 (Attempted Robbery with Use of Force/Repeater)>>GUILTY
13CF629 - Ct. 2 (Strangulation and Suffocation/Repeater)>>GUILTY
13CF629 - Ct. 3 (Threats to Injure/Accuse/Repeater)>>GUILTY
14CF644 - Ct. 1 (Felony BJ/Repeater)>>GUILTY

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty

COURT ORDERS: 
13CF629 - Ct. 1>>3 years TOTAL; 1 year incarceration and 2 years ES
13CF629 - Ct. 2>>8 years TOTAL: 5 years incarceration and 3 years ES
13CF629 - Ct. 3>>6 years TOTAL: 3 years incarceration and 3 years ES
14CF644 - Ct. 1>>3 years TOTAL: 1 year incarceration and 2 years ES

CONDITIONS OF ES: N/C with victim A.W.; Any assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by PO; CC; Restitution of $1157.54 to be paid from $25,000 cash bond and paid to victim; GFE to obtain/maintain FTE.
 
>>All sentences to run CONSECUTIVE to each other
>>Credit in 13CF629 Ct. 1 ONLY>>196 days credit for time already served
>>Defendant is not eligible for CIP or SAP on any of the counts on which he has been sentenced

Adj: 3:20pm

Clerk Cheree
Cases 13CF629, 14CF405 and 14CF644 called: 1:37pm
State appears by ADA M.Puerner; Defendant appears in person/in custody and with Attorney John Wallace.
(CONTINUED MOTION HEARING from 2/9/15)

State notes Defendants motion to change plea to NGI was previously entered at hearing 2/9/15 -- COURT notes examiner was appointed only on the 13CF629 file as that was completed previously, and COURT will not appoint another examiner in that case, now that NGI pleas have been entered in 14CF cases.
COURT notes intent to proceed to trial on 13CF629; Attorney Wallace requests COURT hold off on appointing examiner for the 14CF cases, as parties may have agreement.
Matter set for 2/18 at 2:30 for 30 minutes, and if agreement is not reached, then parties will use that time for MIL that were previously filed by both parties.

Adj: 1:43pm

Clerk Cheree
Cases 13CF629, 14CF405 and 14CF644 called: 2:18pm
State appears by ADA M.Puerner; Defendant appears in person/in custody and with Attorney Wallace

Atty Wallace notes filed motion to change plea - COURT enters NGI pleas in all counts in 14CF405 and 14CF644.
COURT notes Atty Wallace must obtain alternative funding for doctor for eval as court  -- State does not object to hearing being held/set on Wednesday.

COURT notes that there has been an evaluation in 13CF629, and that is file set for trial.
Matter is set over for until 2/11/15 at 1:00pm for status on Atty Wallace being able to obtain funding for NGI eval on 14CF cases.

Adj: 2:26pm
to change plea
STC set
PTC set
to Judge Grau from R.L.W. - includes 14CF405 & 14CF644

ADDRESS INFO for Robert L. Woods
Current: 500 Forest St, c/o Marathon Co Jail, Wausau, WI 54403 United States  (Effective: 12-03-2014)
Prior: 101 1/2 N 3rd Ave, Wausau, WI 54401 United States
Probable Cause Found
of Preliminary Examination

Clerk Cheree
Cases13CF629, 14CF405, 14CF644 called: 11:07am
State appears by ADA M.Puerner; Defendant appears in person/in custody and with Attorney John Wallace
(Prelims in 14CF405 and 14CF644)

Waivers of Prelim. filed.  
Court questions deft as to waivers.
Court finds waivers in each case freely and voluntarily made.
COURT finds PC in each file - Defendant bound over for arraignments & trials.  
Informations filed.  Readings Waived.
Plea:  NOT GUILTY to all counts in each case.
Dates to be set -- Parties to set dates w/JA this afternoon
Bond:  Continued

Adj: 11:12am
Preliminary Hearing on November 11, 2014 at 11:00 am.
Prelim set on 14-CF-405 and 14-CF-644

INCLUDES 13CF629, 14CF405, & 14CF644 No contact with victim(s): A.W. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.   Contact Attic Correctional Services at 715-848-3202 within 30 days. Shall not drive a motor vehicle without valid driver's license.
In MCJ to appear today

Clerk Kim
Case called:  8:49 am
13CF629 and 14CF405

State appears by ADA S. Brubacher for Michael Puerner

Date and time set for bail/bond forfeiture hearing.  Defendant fails to appear. COURT makes findings and enters judgment in the amount of $25,000.00.  BW continues.  State requests restitution in the amount of $422.21 be taken out of bond money.  COURT holds restitution pending resolution of case. 
Adj. 8:51 am

to Forfeit or Modify Bond
INCLUDES 13CF629 & 14CF405 (filed in 14CF405)

BODY ONLY -TO BE BROUGHT IN FRONT OF JUDGE GRAU WHEN DEFENDANT IS APPREHENDED IF AT ALL POSSIBLE
INCLUDES 13CF629 & 14CF405

Clerk Cheree
Cases 13CF629 and 14CF405 called: 10:53am
State appears by ADA M.Puerner; Defendant does NOT appear - Attorney John Wallace appears by phone on his behalf.
(State's Motion re: Bond)

State notes history of case - requests body only BW to appear in front of this court when apprehended.
Atty Wallace requests BW be held until he can speak w/client; Client called him this morning with new phone number, and Atty Wallace left him voicemail.

COURT notes notice sent to defendant, and COURT also advised defendant at last hearing that he was required to be at this hearing regardless of whether he had obtained new counsel, and defendant replied that he understood.

COURT issues BW - body only; and if at all possible, when defendant is apprehended, to be brought before this court.

BFH set for 8/11/14 at 8:30am
John Wallace
of hearing on 7/14/2014 set as Final Pretrial - includes 13CF629 & 14CF405

Clerk Cheree
Cases13CF629 and 14CF405 called: 1:41pm
State appears by ADA M.Puerner; Defendant appears in person and with Atty Lou Ann Bohn.


State notes agreement WAS reached this morning, but now defendant has changed his mind and no longer wishes to accept offer -- Defendant is requesting to remove Atty Bohn as his attorney on both cases.

COURT notes Atty Bohn has been on this case for 11 months, but JT will NOT be adjourned because new attorney cannot be ready for the JT.
COURT draws conclusion that defendant is using delay tactic by firing Atty Bohn with no particular reason given on record.
Defendant states he is contacting PD's office or trying to come up with retainer for a private attorney.

COURT leaves JT date on court's calendar; Parties to set STC w/judge at the end of next week.
COURT orders that defendant must appear at that STC whether he has counsel or not - Defendant states understanding.
Bond continues.

Adj: 1:47pm
Final pre-trial on July 14, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
& inspection
